Key Match Events: Mbappe scored a penalty in the 56th minute.
Lewandowski scored a penalty in the 79th minute.
Rabiot received a yellow card in the 43rd minute.
Zalewski received a yellow card in the 24th minute.
Probierz received a yellow card in the 53rd minute.
Dawidowicz received a yellow card in the 89th minute.
Swiderski received a yellow card in the 90+2 minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Poland were the first side to be officially eliminated from the competition after losing their opening two matches.
Les Bleus are the clear favourites to come through the contest at Borussia Dortmund's Westfalenstadion.
France have not won their final group-stage fixture in any tournament since beating Togo 2-0 at the 2006 World Cup.
France have not lost a single group game at a Euros under Deschamps, a streak which has lasted eight matches.
France have not suffered a single defeat to Poland since 1982, a streak which has lasted eight contests.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match ended in a 1-1 draw.
France have reached four tournament finals since 2006, winning the 2018 World Cup and finishing as runners-up in the other three competitions.
Poland are bidding to avoid losing every game in a European Championship group stage for the first time in their history.
